source_id: STP1467-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_14th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: During the 1980's and $1 9 9 0 ^ { \circ } { \mathrm { s } }$ , the increased fuel element corrosion observed in the "hot" Swiss and German PWR plants prompted the PWR fuel vendors to replace the Zircaloy-4 cladding material with more corrosion resistant materials.

source_id: STP1467-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_14th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: This situation was the driving force for the development of the various PWR corrosion resistant Zr-Nb materials and the Zircaloy materials with low tin contents that are commercially available today.
